page.title: 10ASHTON'S LAWNS FARM
page.content: This is a working farm and freezer centre selling meat and other products to the public,hotels and restaurants. The family have farmed here since 1924.One hand (Brian) has worked here for 28 years.In the last century the farm was the site of stone and coal mining and there was a fire clay mine.The Liverpool-Manchester railway line runs under the farm.The farm fattens cattle and pigs on it's own crops (barley,silage,hay,wheat,oats). In 1981 Ashton imported the first Belgian Blue bull (Lou Lou) and now it's semen and offspring are sold throughout Britain for breeding stock. Belgian Blues produce leaner,tastier meat more quickly than other breeds. The farm has around 200 cattle and 200-300 pigs.It employs 19 people:5 on farm;12 in freezer shop;2 in office.
